title: Sent Mail to Inbox not working
content:
Hi all

I have my sent mail going into my Inbox be default, so that I can see entire threads in context. It's set that way in Copies & Folders in each of my email accounts. However, I frequently find sent emails in the Sent Mail folder.

Can anyone offer an idea of why, and how to fix it?

Thanks Edwin
creator: humphries.edwin

title: can I recover or deleted product
content: Yesterday sometime I accidentally deleted my calendar program and it's a killer I need it bad and if I can't get it I need a simple easy to use replacement it's not asking me a hundred questions just because I want to keep somebody's phone number but what I really want to do is try and find the program a little more before I give up where do deleted products go?

title: password issue
content: one of our email addresses was hacked so we changed the password on that one email account but now we have a pop up window every time we open thunderbird asking to enter the password for two of our addresses. The system won't accept the original password nor the new one. It keeps saying it failed so I can't get into my account passwords screen to see what is going on. We are getting our emails. just that darn window keeps popping up every time. we can send emails too.
creator: RobinClaire

title: Transferring Thunderbird to new laptop
content: When I downloaded the Thunderbird app to my new laptop and opened it, it already had a fortnight's worth of recent messages in the Inbox, plus many of my Sent messages. However, the remainder of the Inbox, dating back to 2010, was not there, neither were my address books. Why didn't a clean copy of the app download so I can import my Profiles? In addition, my old laptop uses POP incoming, but the new laptop seems to be configured to IMAP. Is this a problem, and if so, which should I choose for the new laptop?
creator: cmfindlay
